definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
Beijing University of Aeronautics and Astronautics
pinyin: Bei3 jing1 Hang2 kong1 Hang2 tian1 Da4 xue2

definition: to be as kind and benevolent as heaven (idiom)
Great Sage the Equal of Heaven, self-proclaimed title of the Monkey King Sun Wukong 孫悟空|孙悟空[Sun1 Wu4 kong1] in the novel Journey to the West 西遊記|西游记[Xi1 you2 Ji4]

sentences.english: A banal landscape of ugly new towers flanks both sides.
sentences.chinese: 馬路兩遍的是平凡醜陋的新摩天大樓的景象。

sentences.english: Ken's words turned out to be a huge lie.
sentences.chinese: 阿健的話結果是一個天大的謊言。

sentences.english: China's love for towering skyscrapers just got turned upside down.
sentences.chinese: 中國對摩天大樓的熱愛一百八十度大轉彎。

sentences.english: Skyscrapers are also lavish consumers, and wasters, of electirc power.
sentences.chinese: 摩天大樓還是電能的過度消費者與浪費者。

sentences.english: But first things first: on the face of it, this is tremendously good news.
sentences.chinese: 不過首先，從表面上看，這是一個天大的好消息。

sentences.english: Unlike a skyscraper, your garden will grow weeds.
sentences.chinese: 和摩天大樓不同，你的花園會長出野草。

sentences.english: Did they do this a long time ago?
sentences.chinese: 他們在很久以前建造摩天大廈嗎？

sentences.english: How many floors does that skyscraper have?
sentences.chinese: 那棟摩天大樓有幾多層樓？

sentences.english: It is, in fact, great good fortune.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，那是天大的福分。

sentences.english: The former now has more skyscrapers than the latter.
sentences.chinese: 前者如今擁有的摩天大樓比後者還多。

sentences.english: It is a new kind of concrete reinforcing product which is made of PP material.
sentences.chinese: 就是有天大的困難，我們也要把這種產品試製成功。

sentences.english: Nancy:And it's one of the most famous buildings in the world, it was the first skyscraper.
sentences.chinese: 它是世界著名的建築物之一，是第一座摩天大廈。

sentences.english: Is small to work properly son you nice variety, incredibly challenge to my Sa monstrous prevaricate favor this?
sentences.chinese: 小靈子你好樣的，居然敢對我撒這樣的彌天大謊？

sentences.english: He is Sun Wukong, the Great Sage Equaling Heaven, who made havoc in Heaven.
sentences.chinese: 就是那大鬧天宮的齊天大聖孫悟空。

sentences.english: S was the first person to photograph skyscrapers, clouds and views from the airplane.
sentences.chinese: 是第一個拍摩天大樓，雲和從飛機上看到的景象的人。

sentences.english: Skyscrapers are also lavish consumers, and wasters, of electric power.
sentences.chinese: 摩天大廈，也有豪華的消費者，和廢物，電力等。

definition: good action, deed, thing or work (also sarcastic, "a fine thing indeed")/charity/happy occasion/Daoist or Buddhist ceremony for the souls of the dead
extremely rare (idiom)/once in a blue moon
let alone/to say nothing of/besides/what's more
